tutorials.title: Programming
tutorials.descriptionContent: Programming is the art of telling computers what to do. This course uses natural language to introduce very basic programming concepts like selection and repetition.
tutorials.descriptionAudience: Absolute beginners without any programming experience

tutorials.title: Programming 2
tutorials.descriptionContent: This course picks up where the Introduction to Programming ended and introduces more advanced topics such as lists and procedures.
tutorials.descriptionAudience: Absolute beginners who have completed the Introduction to Programming course

tutorials.title: Swift
tutorials.descriptionContent: Swift is a programming language developed for iOS and macOS development. This course starts with the very basics of Swift and advances to complex topics like OOP and closures.
tutorials.descriptionAudience: Beginners with a basic understanding of macOS

tutorials.title: Exploring Xcode
tutorials.descriptionContent: This project sets up Xcode along with Playgrounds and creates an initial experiment in a Playground.
tutorials.descriptionAudience: Beginners with a basic understanding of programming and the Swift syntax

tutorials.title: Build an App 1
tutorials.descriptionContent: This project explores the model-view-controller pattern and introduces the Interface Builder to create a simple iOS app.
tutorials.descriptionAudience: Everybody with a basic understanding of Swift and Xcode

tutorials.title: Build an App 2
tutorials.descriptionContent: This project extends the simple iOS app from the previous project to an interactive number guessing game.
tutorials.descriptionAudience: Finishers of Building an iOS App 1 and the Swift course

tutorials.title: HTML
tutorials.descriptionContent: HTML is the language of the Internet. This course introduces the basic structure of a web page, common tags and simple ways to style web pages.
tutorials.descriptionAudience: Beginners and intermediate programmers who want to know how web pages work

tutorials.title: Make a Website 1
tutorials.descriptionContent: This project sets up an environment and uses HTML to create the structure for a simple blog.
tutorials.descriptionAudience: Everybody with a basic understanding of HTML

tutorials.title: CSS
tutorials.descriptionContent: Cascading style sheets are the secret sauce of every beautiful web page. This course starts with basic selectors and properties and advances to the box model and more complex layouts.
tutorials.descriptionAudience: Everybody with a basic understanding of HTML and text editors

tutorials.title: Make a Website 2
tutorials.descriptionContent: This project extends the structure from the previous project into a presentable and publishable blog.
tutorials.descriptionAudience: Everybody with a basic understanding of HTML and CSS

tutorials.title: JavaScript
tutorials.descriptionContent: JavaScript is the programming language of the Web; it’s easy to use and powerful at the same time. This course starts with the very basics and advances to JS objects and the HTML DOM.
tutorials.descriptionAudience: Everybody who wants to hit the ground running and switchers who want to review the JavaScript syntax

tutorials.title: Cybersecurity
tutorials.descriptionContent: Hacking is the practice of manipulating systems for good or bad purposes. This course introduces cybersecurity, cryptography, and hacking techniques from a hacker's perspective.
tutorials.descriptionAudience: Intermediates with a bit of programming experience

tutorials.title: SQL
tutorials.descriptionContent: SQL is the standard language for anything database. Starting with the concepts of databases, tables and queries, this course advances to functions and relations.
tutorials.descriptionAudience: Everybody who's curious about and unfamiliar with the SQL syntax or needs a refresher

tutorials.title: SQL Injection
tutorials.descriptionContent: This project reveal vulnerabilities in a training-ground cryptocurrency trading platform and uses SQL injection to change email addresses and passwords.
tutorials.descriptionAudience: Intermediates who know SQL and have completed the SQL Injection chapter in the Hacking course

tutorials.title: Python
tutorials.descriptionContent: Often taught at schools, Python is a simple but powerful programming language. This course starts with the very basics and advances to more complex data structures and classes.
tutorials.descriptionAudience: Beginners and early-stage switchers from other programming languages

tutorials.title: Git
tutorials.descriptionContent: Git is a version control system for tracking changes in files and coordinating work on them in teams. This course is an introduction to the command-line Git syntax and the Git workflow.
tutorials.descriptionAudience: Beginners and advanced users who want to understand how modern version control works

tutorials.title: Java
tutorials.descriptionContent: Java is the language of choice for Android developers. This course teaches the essentials of Java and peeks into object-oriented programming.
tutorials.descriptionAudience: Beginners who want to learn an enterprise-level programming language

tutorials.title: Ruby
tutorials.descriptionContent: Ruby is an easy-to-learn and powerful programming language for many purposes. This course introduces the Ruby syntax along with basic programming concepts.
tutorials.descriptionAudience: Beginners and early-stage switchers from other programming languages

tutorials.title: C#
tutorials.descriptionContent: C# is a cross-platform programming language that is widely used to build apps, games and websites. This course covers the essentials of the C# syntax and development routine.
tutorials.descriptionAudience: Beginners who want to learn an enterprise-level programming language

tutorials.title: C++
tutorials.descriptionContent: C++ is a popular (but also tricky) programming language for serious development of any kind. This course provides an introduction into the syntax and principles of C++.
tutorials.descriptionAudience: Beginners and switchers who are computer-fluent and up for a challenge

tutorials.title: Terminal
tutorials.descriptionContent: The Terminal isn't just for nerds. It's actually a fantastic tool with almost limitless functionality. This course is a primer on how the command line works and almost anything is possible with it.
tutorials.descriptionAudience: Linux and macOS users with little or no command line experience

tutorials.title: ArnoldC
tutorials.descriptionContent: ArnoldC is a programming language that’s based on quotes from Arnold Schwarzenegger movies. This course provides a brief introduction to the ArnoldC syntax.
tutorials.descriptionAudience: Everybody with a basic understanding of programming concepts who’s looking for a quick laugh
